Court Of Equity.definition: a court having jurisdiction over suits in equity and administering justice and providing remedies according to the rules and principles of equity compare court of law NOTE

1.1: a court having jurisdiction over suits in equity and administering justice and providing remedies according to the rules and principles of equity compare
1.note: Rule 1 of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure abolishes the distinction between law and equity, and therefore there are no longer courts of equity in the federal system.
